page.title: 01Halewood - an introduction.
page.content: The town of Halewood is situated about nine miles south east of Liverpool city centre. It does not, however, form part of Liverpool but belongs to the Metropolitan Borough of Knowsley. Much change has occurred over the last twenty years.Having once been a rural area, Halewood is now a mixture of fairly high density housing and arable land. There are also a couple of large factories in the area. The area of Halewood is about 3,116 acres.The most recent estimate puts the population at about 21,000 living in approximately 7,000 domestic dwellings.
